doc.after: In Muslim tradition, Muhammad (c. 570 â June 8, 632) is viewed as the seal of prophets.[140] During the last 22 years of his life, beginning at age 40 in 610 CE, according to the earliest surviving biographies, Muhammad reported revelations that he believed to be from God conveyed to him through the archangel Gabriel (Jibril). The content of these revelations, known as the Qur'an, was memorized and recorded by his companions.[141]
